docs.abstract: The regulator’s employees had raised concerns about a rudder system. Now two powerful House members want answers.
docs.snippet: The regulator’s employees had raised concerns about a rudder system. Now two powerful House members want answers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Two of the most powerful lawmakers on the House transportation committee demanded Thursday that the Federal Aviation Administration explain why some of its managers overruled the agency’s own safety experts during the development of Boeing’s 737 Max plane.

headline.main: Legislators Call On F.A.A. to Say Why It Overruled Its Experts on 737 Max
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Ask Why F.A.A. Ignored Safety Experts

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Boeing 737 Max Groundings and Safety Concerns (2019)

byline.original: By Natalie Kitroeff and David Gelles

docs.abstract: The European Central Bank chief is internationally prominent, but her monetary views are less clear. That started to change at a news conference on Thursday.
docs.snippet: The European Central Bank chief is internationally prominent, but her monetary views are less clear. That started to change at a news conference on Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — Christine Lagarde is one of the most recognizable people on the world stage, but as president of the European Central Bank, a job she began six weeks ago, she has been a cipher.

headline.main: Christine Lagarde Begins to Chart a Course at the E.C.B.
headline.print_headline: In First E.C.B. Address, Lagarde Stresses Value Of Many Points of View

docs.abstract: The National Labor Relations Board ordered a judge to approve a settlement that doesn’t consider the fast-food giant liable for labor law violations by its franchisees.
docs.snippet: The National Labor Relations Board ordered a judge to approve a settlement that doesn’t consider the fast-food giant liable for labor law violations by its franchisees.
docs.lead_paragraph: The federal labor board handed McDonald’s a major victory on Thursday, ordering a judge to approve a proposed settlement between the company and the government that the judge had previously rejected.

headline.main: McDonald’s Notches Big Victory in Labor Board Ruling
headline.print_headline: Labor Decision On Settlement Awards Victory To McDonald’s

docs.abstract: The for-profit school lured students by advertising employer partnerships that did not exist, the Federal Trade Commission said.
docs.snippet: The for-profit school lured students by advertising employer partnerships that did not exist, the Federal Trade Commission said.
docs.lead_paragraph: The University of Phoenix, one of the nation’s largest for-profit college chains, agreed to a $191 million settlement on Tuesday with the Federal Trade Commission, which said the school had lured in students with fraudulent claims about partnerships with major companies that one of the chain’s own executives had described as “smoke and mirrors.”

headline.main: University of Phoenix Cancels $141 Million in Debt for ‘Deceptive’ Ads

docs.abstract: Critics accuse the kingdom of “sportswashing” as international entertainment businesses shrug off human rights concerns.
docs.snippet: Critics accuse the kingdom of “sportswashing” as international entertainment businesses shrug off human rights concerns.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia — On Halloween, as two female WWE wrestlers battled inside a roaring King Fahd International Stadium, Najla Ibrahim stood with a hand on her heart and another in the air, capturing the moment with her smartphone. For years, the nurse from Riyadh followed wrestling from afar and yearned for the day when women would take the ring in her country.

headline.main: Saudi Arabia Embraces Western Sports to Rehabilitate Global Image

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

keywords.name: persons
keywords.value: Reema bint Bandar bin Sultan, Princess of Saudi Arabia

docs.abstract: The end of a 90-day pause on the taxation of technology companies and other corners of the digital economy raised questions of whether the president would revive threats against French wine.
docs.snippet: The end of a 90-day pause on the taxation of technology companies and other corners of the digital economy raised questions of whether the president would revive threats against French wine.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A brief truce in what had been an escalating battle between the United States and France over taxing digital services has expired, but President Trump gave no indication this week whether he planned to return to his threats to impose new tariffs on imported wine and other French products as a result.

headline.main: Trump’s Tax Truce With France Expires, but the Path Ahead Remains Unclear
headline.print_headline: U.S. Trade Path With France Uncertain as a Tax Truce Expires

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development

byline.original: By Jim Tankersley and Alan Rappeport

docs.abstract: In a series of moves and comments, the president has stirred new turmoil into financial markets and the global economy.
docs.snippet: In a series of moves and comments, the president has stirred new turmoil into financial markets and the global economy.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — President Trump left the global economy unsettled on Tuesday when he threatened NATO allies and suggested that he could wait a year to reach a trade agreement with China, sending stock markets swooning.

headline.main: Trump Inflames the Trade Wars, Again
headline.print_headline: Trade Outlook:  No Truce Soon,  But New Fronts

byline.original: By Katie Rogers, Jim Tankersley and Alan Rappeport

docs.abstract: A coal town in southwestern Virginia has been trying for years. Hope is running thin.
docs.snippet: A coal town in southwestern Virginia has been trying for years. Hope is running thin.
docs.lead_paragraph: GRUNDY, Va. — Jay Rife surveys the landscape — hundreds of flat, grassy acres reclaimed from a spent mountaintop mine once operated by the Paramont Coal Company. A few handsome homes stand on one end of the project. An 80,000-square-foot shell, to house some future manufacturing operation, is being built on another. For the intrepid, there are trails for all-terrain vehicles. There’s an R.V. park. The whole site has been wired for broadband. Elk have been imported from Kentucky for tourists to look at.

headline.main: Can a Coal Town Reinvent Itself?
headline.print_headline: Struggling to Rise as Coal Declines

docs.abstract: Until Friday, few executives had complained in public about how Google, Apple, Amazon and Facebook hurt their businesses.
docs.snippet: Until Friday, few executives had complained in public about how Google, Apple, Amazon and Facebook hurt their businesses.
docs.lead_paragraph: For all the criticisms directed at the largest tech companies in the last couple of years, few smaller rivals have been willing to speak up publicly.

headline.main: Please Stop Big Tech, Small Rivals Tell Lawmakers

docs.abstract: Aventura Mall, near Miami, isn’t shy about investing in its infrastructure and is widely considered one of the most successful malls in the country.
docs.snippet: Aventura Mall, near Miami, isn’t shy about investing in its infrastructure and is widely considered one of the most successful malls in the country.
docs.lead_paragraph: Some retailers have turned to extras like virtual-reality headsets and touch-screen mirrors to give shoppers an experience they can’t get online.

headline.main: Dying Malls? This One Has Found a Way to Thrive
